title: Introducing: Soft As Snow
body:
With two tracks to their name, coming in at a combined total of over twelve minutes, Norwegian born, London based pop duo Soft As Snow are certainly ambitious.

A cross between the nu-gaze revival that reared it’s head a couple of years back, and the (at times) occasionally passive dream-pop that appears to be dominating blogs at the moment, Oda Egjar Starheim and Øystein Monsen manage to keep their tracks exhilarating from start to finish. Of the two songs, _Black Birds_ is the one that excites me most, with it’s shoegaze leanings, whilst _Glass Body_ squeezes more into the aforementioned dream-pop territory.
